intro: Lachenalia klinghardtiana, commonly known as the Klein's lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, linear leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically in spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
